firemon_api.core.query¶

class firemon_api.core.query.Request(base: str, session: Session, filters: dict | None = None, key: str | None = None, url: str | None = None, headers: dict | None = None, cookies: dict | None = None, trailing_slash: bool = False)¶

Bases: object

Creates requests to the FireMon API Responsible for building the url and making the HTTPS requests to FireMon’s API

Parameters:

  • base (str) –

  • session (Session) – requests

Keyword Arguments:

  • filters (dict, optional) – contains key/value pairs that correlate to the filters a given endpoint accepts.

  • key (str, optional) – append to base to make up full url

  • headers (dict, optional) – specific headers to over ride session headers

  • cookies (dict, optional) –

  • trailing_slash (bool) – Ensure a trailing slash for self.url`retry_count (int): number of times to retry request call for any error except `RequestError. Helps with flakey connections.

concurrent_get(ret: dict, page_size: int, page_range: list) → None¶
delete() → bool¶

Makes DELETE request. Makes a DELETE request to Firemon API.

Returns:

(bool) True if successful.

Raises:

RequestError if req.ok doesn't return True. –

get(add_params=None) → bool | dict | str | bytes¶

Makes a GET request. Makes a GET request to FireMon API, and automatically recurses any paginated results.

Raises:

RequestError – if req.ok returns false.

Returns:

data from the endpoint.

Return type:

dict

get_content() → bytes¶

Get content

Warning

In some cases the appending of default pageSize my break our API calls. Appears to happen when requesting data blobs but not always.

get_count() → int¶

Returns object count for query returns the value of the “total” field.

Returns:

number of objects query returned

Return type:

(int)

Raises:

  • RequestError if req.ok returns false. –

  • ContentError if response is not json. –

normalize_key(key: str) → str¶
normalize_url(url: str, trailing_slash=False) → str¶
post(json=None, data=None, files=None) → bool | dict | str | bytes¶

Makes POST request. Makes a POST request to Firemon API.

Keyword Arguments:

  • json (dict) – Contains a dict that will be turned

  • API. (into a json and sent to the) –

  • data (dict) – x-form-url

  • files (list/dict) – See Requests how-to

  • formatted (dict) – (‘file’, bytes, ‘text/plain’)) or (‘file’, (‘<file-name>’, open(<path_to_file>, ‘rb’))

  • formatted – {‘file’: bytes} or {‘file’: (‘<file-name>’, open(<path_to_file>, ‘rb’)} or {‘devicepack.jar’: bytes}

Raises:

RequestError – if req.ok returns false.

Returns:

data from the endpoint.

Return type:

dict

post_cpl_auth(data=None)¶

Authorize to the Control Panel and get Cookie Jar

put(json=None, data=None) → bool | dict | str | bytes¶

Makes PUT request. Makes a PUT request to Firemon API. Not sure why we have PUT statements with no data but it is what it is.

Keyword Arguments:

  • json (dict) – Contains a dict that will be turned into a json object and sent to the API.

  • data (dict) – x-form-url

Raises:

RequestError – if req.ok returns false.

Returns:

data from the endpoint.

Return type:

dict

exception firemon_api.core.query.RequestError(message)¶

Bases: FiremonApiError

Basic Request Exception More detailed exception that returns the original requests object for inspection. Along with some attributes with specific details from the requests object. If return is json we decode and add it to the message.

firemon_api.core.query.calc_pages(pageSize: int, total: int) → int¶

Calculate number of pages required for full results set.

firemon_api.core.query.url_param_builder(param_dict: dict) → str¶

Builds url parameters Creates URL paramters (e.g. ‘…/?xyz=r21&abc=123’) from a dict passed in param_dict

FireMon-API is a Python web wrapper for the FireMon SIP (Security Mangager, etc...) APIs. The intent is make something that is useful for quick and easy development against FireMon products.
